page.title: 13Religion
page.content: on the top of a small hill in the middle of fields. It goes back to the eleventh century but the dedication suggests a church on this site before the Norman Conquest. It is thought that there used to be a village around the church but in the time of the Black Death people left and never came back. There are twelve people on the electoral roll. There is a private burial ground at the entrance to Hornets Farm, Beauchamp Roding. The interesting feature is the tomb of Mrs. Susan Mead. Her husband, Isaac Mead (l859-l945) a farm labourer from the age of eleven, by hard work became a farmer and master miller. He also read widely and in l923 published his autobiography "The Story of an Essex Lad".
